A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
If Skywalker was the same guy we knew\, we wouldn't have needed three more movies.  The reasons given were compelling.  The way Skywalker engages was awesome.  The head fakes and echos were head and shoulders beyond anything in the prequel trilogy.   And anyone who thinks that the Last Jedi drags should watch A New Hope with someone for the first time.

As someone who personally believes in the supernatural\, namely God\, I appreciate the refocusing on the Force - the Jedi don't own the Force\, they don't own the Light\, they serve the Light.  Our human institutions don't define spiritual reality\, they only point to it.  The Jedi are a human institution\, and the Force can obviously awaken who it will\, use who it wills.  When we look at human institutions\, they rise and fall\, they wax and wane.  Either the Force is beyond all of that or it isn't.  Renewal\, Reformation\, Revival doesn't have to look like our current reality\, in fact\, it shouldn't.  People who want things the way they were might care more about the success of a human institution\, in this case the Jedi Order/Jedi Religion\, versus the reality (in that world) of the Force.  

Not that anyone cares\, but it is now my second favorite Star Wars\, just behind Empire Strikes Back.

Best lightsaber battles\, period.   After watching it again. it even beats Obi Wan/Maul and the Luke/Vader rematch.

If I were to deduct half a star\, it would be over that nasty milk scene.  :p
